issue.title: Previously Appended HTML Event Listener in Layer Control is Overwritten When More Overlays Added
issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've looked at the [documentation](https://leafletjs.com/reference.html) to make sure the behavior isn't documented and expected.
- [X] I'm sure this is an issue with Leaflet, not with my app or other dependencies (Angular, Cordova, React, etc.).
- [X] I've searched through the [current issues](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/issues) to make sure this hasn't been reported yet.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create the Layer Control object
2. Add baselayers
3. Create marker group overlay layer
4. Add it to the Layer Control with custom HTML e.g.
 `layerControl.addOverlay(layer, "<button id='"+buttonID+"'>Go To "+name+"</button> "+name);)`
6. Add a click event to the button e.g.
```
let button = document.getElementById(buttonID);
 L.DomEvent.on(button, 'click', function () {
		map.fitBounds(layer.getBounds()); // Assuming eventMarkerGroup has a getBounds method
	});
```
8. Label and button gets added correctly to layer control, works as expected
9. Make another overlay layer
10. Add it to the Layer Control as above
11. Removes the onClick event that was previously appended to the button from the previous layer


### Expected behavior

Each time an overlay is added, its button should be added next to the label and the button should work as expected.

### Current behavior

The first layer button is added, and then its functionality is removed when further layers are added, however the button itself stays. The end result is that none of the buttons onClick event work. When I just isolate the code to add one layer, it works as expected. 

### Minimal example reproducing the issue

https://plnkr.co/edit/MT9gbfKiOuz1U6Yq

### Environment

- Leaflet version: 1.7.1
- Browser (with version): Chrome 118.0.0.0
- OS/Platform (with version): Windows 11 Laptop

forkee.name: Leaflet
forkee.description: 🍃 JavaScript library for mobile-friendly interactive maps 🇺🇦

### Checklist

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create the Layer Control object
2. Add baselayers
3. Create marker group overlay layer
4. Add it to the Layer Control with custom HTML e.g.

6. Add a click event to the button e.g.
```
let button = document.getElementById(buttonID);

		map.fitBounds(layer.getBounds()); // Assuming eventMarkerGroup has a getBounds method
	});
```
8. Label and button gets added correctly to layer control, works as expected
9. Make another overlay layer
10. Add it to the Layer Control as above
11. Removes the onClick event that was previously appended to the button from the previous layer


### Expected behavior

https://plnkr.co/edit/MT9gbfKiOuz1U6Yq

### Environment

- Leaflet version: 1.7.1
- Browser (with version): Chrome 118.0.0.0
- OS/Platform (with version): Windows 11 Laptop

comment.body: Okay, this is due to the features for the layers still being added when the layer is added to the control I think. I have worked around it by not adding the event listeners until all layer functions have finished and their label with the button has been added to the control. Then I loop through the label buttons and add their onClick events. Unsure if this should now be closed or not, as the problem still remains that existing event listeners are affected when new overlays are added to the control.

issue.title: Specific marker's tooltip appears when clicking outside the map

comment.body: I just downgraded Leaflet to v1.9.3, and it now works as intended, so this seems to be something that was introduced in 1.9.4.

issue.title: Specific marker's tooltip appears when clicking outside the map

comment.body: Also, it seems to work as intended if I use `bindTooltip` instead of `bindPopup` but as I have links inside the information box that pops up, that's not a viable solution for me.

Previously Appended HTML Event Listener in Layer Control is Overwritten When More Overlays Added
issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've looked at the [documentation](https://leafletjs.com/reference.html) to make sure the behavior isn't documented and expected.
- [X] I'm sure this is an issue with Leaflet, not with my app or other dependencies (Angular, Cordova, React, etc.).
- [X] I've searched through the [current issues](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/issues) to make sure this hasn't been reported yet.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create the Layer Control object
2. Add baselayers
3. Create marker group overlay layer
4. Add it to the Layer Control with custom HTML e.g.
 `layerControl.addOverlay(layer, "<button id='"+buttonID+"'>Go To "+name+"</button> "+name);)`
6. Add a click event to the button e.g.
```
let button = document.getElementById(buttonID);
 L.DomEvent.on(button, 'click', function () {
		map.fitBounds(layer.getBounds()); // Assuming eventMarkerGroup has a getBounds method
	});
```
8. Label and button gets added correctly to layer control, works as expected
9. Make another overlay layer
10. Add it to the Layer Control as above
11. Removes the onClick event that was previously appended to the button from the previous layer


### Expected behavior

Each time an overlay is added, its button should be added next to the label and the button should work as expected.

### Current behavior

The first layer button is added, and then its functionality is removed when further layers are added, however the button itself stays. The end result is that none of the buttons onClick event work. When I just isolate the code to add one layer, it works as expected.

- OS/Platform (with version): Windows 11 Laptop

issue.title: Help should be provided for the map container keyboard shortcuts [accessibility]
issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I've looked at the [documentation](https://leafletjs.com/reference.html) to make sure the behavior isn't documented and expected.
- [X] I'm sure this is an issue with Leaflet, not with my app or other dependencies (Angular, Cordova, React, etc.).
- [X] I've searched through the [current issues](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/issues) to make sure this hasn't been reported yet.
- [X] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.

## Problem ##

Labels or instructions should be provided when content requires user input.

As a keyboard user, I prefer to use the keyboard for _all_ interactions.

It was only some time after I began using Leaflet, that I discovered by chance that you can use arrow keys to pan around the map and the `+` and `-` keys to zoom in and out. They are not obvious!

There should be something like a popup to explain the keyboard shortcuts.

* WCAG 2.2 [Success Criterion 3.3.2 Labels or Instructions](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/#labels-or-instructions)
* Affected users: mobility, assistive technology (screen reader) users.

## Solution

I'd like to propose something similar to the solution in [Google Maps](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/overview). That is, a “Keyboard shortcuts” button that appears visually at the bottom-right of the map, next to the attribution links.

The button opens a dialog that summarises the available keyboard shortcuts. 

Screenshots to follow!

![Screenshot 1: Google Maps - keyboard shortcuts button](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/assets/131235/973cefa1-5777-4ea5-83c6-4bbb16a66b6c)

![Screenshot 2: Google Maps - keyboard shortcuts dialog](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/assets/131235/b6a0adb9-095c-4dd2-aaf0-cab734598be0)

### Focus Order

Although visually the “Keyboard shortcuts” button can appear at the bottom of the map, it should be before the map container in the keyboard focus order. Otherwise, it won't be available to a keyboard user until they're past the container!

### Minimal example reproducing the issue

_No response_

### Environment

- Leaflet version: 1.9.4,
- Browser (with version): Chrome 114,
- OS/Platform (with version): Mac OS 10.14.6.

comment.body:
Hi @samclaus,

Thank you for your feedback. I'll try to respond to a few of your points.

> Outside of that core functionality, I don't want Leaflet to do too much and bloat my application.
>
I agree that Leaflet needs to stay small and focus on its key functionality. We can argue about what the core functionality includes - for me, the keyboard shortcuts are essential, so explaining them is also important.

> ... some people probably want different keyboard shortcuts than the ones that are currently baked in.
>
For interest, the shortcuts are the same as for Google Maps, which is a good thing.

> ... thankfully they can just omit the keyboard handler
>
I hope most people won't omit it - if you need to use a keyboard, it's important.

> My point is, features like keyboard shortcuts ... may be better suited as the responsibility of final applications
>
We'll see what others think.

Best wishes,

Nick

issue.title: docs: Add "Leaflet.translate" to the plugin list
issue.body:
Hi,

This plugin is in support of step 7 ("_Create a repo ..._") in #9092.

Please review and merge.

Regards,

Nick

comment.body:
Hi @Malvoz, @Falke-Design & All,

Would someone be able to take a look at this pull request to add [Leaflet.translate](https://github.com/nfreear/leaflet.plugins#readme) to the plugins list please?

Thanks,

Nick
